result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Craig Beanland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Without Huber or work release privileges.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 16CM37

miscConds.notes:
Undergo AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.

Complete domestic violence treatment if deemed appropriate by agent.

Comply with any other conditions, no contacts or assessments per agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Fudge.  Court orders $250 Cash Bond with conditions.

Initial appearance on April 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  
DEFENDANT MAY ONLY BE RELEASED ON WEEKDAYS (EXCLUDING HOLIDAYS) FROM 8:00 A.M. UNTIL 4:00 P.M.  DEFENDANT MUST GO IMMEDIATELY TO THE JUSTICE PROGRAMS OFFICE UPON SIGNING OF BOND AND/OR RELEASE.  THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
CURFEW FROM 7:00 P.M. UNTIL 7:00 A.M. EXCEPT FOR WORK, TREATMENT OR TESTING PURPOSES ONLY IF APPROVED BY BOND MONITORING AHEAD OF TIME.
